title: Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tbsp unsalted butter, melted and cooled, plus 1/4 cup melted for frying
directions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Stir until well mixed and make a well in the center.
Pour the eggs, the milk, and the two tbsp melted butter into the well. Whisk from the center outward, until the ingredients are combined, but still a little lumpy.
Preheat a nonstick or cast-iron griddle over medium-high heat.
Brush the griddle with melted butter.
Ladle 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle.
When pancakes have begun to bubble in the center and a few of the bubbles have popped and the undersides are golden , flip the pancakes.
Cook until the second side is golden, then transfer to a platter.
Cook remaining pancakes in the same way, adding butter as needed.
